hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regime (confidence >55%), a CPI print surprise (>0.2% deviation from consensus) triggers asymmetric price amplification in BTC over the following 24 hours, with direction matching the surprise sign (lower CPI → bullish, higher CPI → bearish), generating >1.5x the expected move implied by pre-release options pricing.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes exhibit suppressed volatility and indecision. Macro catalysts provide clear directional signals that are amplified as sidelined capital reacts. Recent CPI surprise (2.7% vs expected) triggered outsized moves. Options markets systematically underprice post-catalyst volatility expansion in neutral environments.
entry_conditions: CPI release occurs with headline/core deviation >0.2% from Bloomberg consensus
BTC 1-hour post-release price moves in direction of surprise (lower CPI → price > pre-release high, higher CPI → price < pre-release low)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 24 hours after entry OR 3x the pre-release ATM IV move (whichever comes first)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses to pre-release level (invalidating initial reaction)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 24-hour post-CPI move magnitude <1.2x the pre-release ATM IV-implied move across 10+ events in NEUTRAL regime.
